articleContentTranslated: Suljovic's big World Cup goal in his 13th World Cup participation is once again to make it to the quarter-finals for the first time. Last year the Viennese had already lost his first match against the Englishwoman Fallon Sherrock.
With the first two victories of a woman at a PDC World Cup, â€œThe Queen of the Palaceâ€ was even worth a story for the â€œNew York Timesâ€. For this year's title fights she could not qualify.

Suljovic celebrated his greatest World Cup successes in 2011, 2016 and 2018 when he reached the round of 16. In the match against Edgar, â€œThe Gentleâ€ showed a sovereign performance and even had an average of over 100 until shortly before the end. Ultimately, he finished the match with an average of 98.18.

Suljovic's best average in a World Cup match so far is 99.4 (2016). ğ— ğ—”ğ—¥ğ—©ğ—˜ğ—Ÿğ—Ÿğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—¦ ğ— ğ—˜ğ—¡ğ—¦ğ—¨ğ—¥ Mensur Suljovic hits seven 180s on his way to an impressive 3-1 victory over darts' biggest internet star Matthew Edgar!

A clinical tournament for Edgar who hit 65% of his attempted doubles, but he just comes up short against Suljovic ... pic.twitter.com/4w3wITdGhLâ€” PDC Darts (@OfficialPDC) December 23, 2020 Key to 3:
1 success of the Viennese was a 140 check-out at the beginning of the fourth movement, with which he broke Edgar. : On the way to victory, Suljovic once had seven perfect darts (180s) in a row.

Only two arrows were missing for the nine-o'clock, which was last won at a World Cup by Scots Anderson in a 6-0 win against Dutchman Jelle Klaasen on January 2nd, 2016. Also former world champion Anderson sovereign Anderson had previously reached the third round without much effort .
â€œThe Flying Scotsmanâ€ defeated the Latvian Madars Razma 3: 1 and will be able to compete again at the Alexandra Palace after Christmas.

The penultimate leg of the match was won by the 50-year-old Scot, seeded number 13, with a 161 check-out. ğŸ­ğŸ²ğŸ­ ğ—–ğ—›ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ That is world class from Gary Anderson as he goes within one leg of the match, firing in a MASSIVE 161 finish!

pic.twitter.com/YYOGKaLBR6â€” PDC Darts (@OfficialPDC) December 23, 2020 A smooth start to the tournament was important for the 2015 and 2016 world champions because he was last in quarantine after a coronavirus case in his area.

The world association PDC postponed the match between Anderson and Razma, which was actually scheduled for December 20, by three days. Bunting wins crime against Boulton In a duel between two Englishmen, Stephen Bunting narrowly prevailed against Andy Boulton 3-2.
A look at the statistics shows how close the game was. Both players had a double rate of 35.71 percent. In the average, Boulton was even just ahead of world number 26 with 95.36. Bunting (93.21).
The decisive fifth leg in the fifth set was secured by â€œThe Bulletâ€ with an eleven darter - and that was also necessary because Boulton was also on his way to a finish with eleven arrows.
